description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ahfcb","text":"Here we provide a SOP to outline the correct procedures to dual stain FFPE human tissue for, 1) pathological TDP-43 protein, along with 2) any other protein of interest, with the aim of visualising protein of interest histology in the context of TDP-43 pathology.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ov80","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct3dq","text":"This protocol can be implemented for dual staining of any rabbit or mouse primary detection antibody (using the Novolink Polymer Detection System), with our TDP-43 RNA aptamer (biotinylated) as published in Acta\nNeuropathologica here https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00401-024-02705-1 in Spence and Waldron et al., 2024. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":207,"length":22},{"style":"italic","offset":317,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":234,"length":60}],"data":{}},{"key":"d9kuk","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epoet","text":"The resulting dual stain will show brown chromogen (detecting the target of the primary antibody) with red chromogen (detecting TDP-43 pathology with our TDP-43 RNA aptamer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bonk7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn6cc","text":"Reference for citations of this method","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ic8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rd3s","text":"Clinicopathological analysis of NEK1 variants in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":79},{"style":"italic","offset":32,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv9d4","text":"Olivia M. Rifai, Fergal M. Waldron, Danah Sleibi, Judi O’Shaughnessy, Danielle J. Leighton*, Jenna M. Gregory*‡ (2024). Brain Pathology doi: 10.1111/bpa.13287  (in press at the time of publication of this SOP) *equal contributions, ‡corresponding author.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":110,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":232,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":120,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bec0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3219u","text":"Antibody and TDP-43 RNA aptamer dual staining to detect patterns of  co-pathology in FFPE-preserved human tissue, as described in Rifai et al., 2024 (Brain Pathology): An SOP and tick-sheet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":189}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hcc6","text":"Fergal M. Waldron, Olivia M. Rifai, Jenna M. Gregory‡, (2024). Protocols.io 2024; doi: tbc","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":52,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t2sb","text":"‡corresponding author","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FB528DE439D711EFBA840A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00401-024-02705-1"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

title: Antibody and TDP-43 RNA aptamer dual staining to detect patterns of  co-pathology in FFPE-preserved human tissue, as described in Rifai et al., 2024 (Brain Pathology): A SOP and tick-sheet.
